snippet: “The Wind Rises,” the newest animated film from the Japanese director Hayao Miyazaki, has received complaints because of its focus on the creation of a fighter used during World War II.
abstract: Director and writer Hayao Miyazaki says his latest animated film The Wind Rises will be his last; film was box-office smash in Japan, has been praised by critics and is considered likely Oscar nominee, but controversial subject matter prompts American distributor to give it the minimum release time allowed for it to qualify for Academy Award.
lead_paragraph: “The Wind Rises,” the newest animated film from the Japanese director Hayao Miyazaki, has received complaints because of its focus on the creation of a fighter used during World War II.

headline.seo: Hayao Miyazaki’s Last Film, ‘The Wind Rises,’ Gets Complaints
headline.main: Swan Song Too Hawkish for Some
headline.print_headline: Swan Song Too Hawkish For Some
